# How the main Wavelength game works (for AI explanations)
wavelength-gameplay:
  - One player becomes the Psychic and sees a hidden target on a spectrum
  - The spectrum has two opposing concepts (e.g., "Hot" vs "Cold")
  - The Psychic gives a one-word clue suggesting where the target is
  - Other players guess the position based on the clue
  - Points awarded based on accuracy: 4 (bullseye), 3 (close), 2 (near), 0 (miss)

# How mini games work
mini-games-gameplay:
  this-or-that:
    - Both players see two options (e.g., "Beach vacation" vs "Mountain trip")
    - 10 seconds to choose
    - Score a point when both players pick the same answer
  red-flag-green-flag:
    - Both players see a dating behavior scenario
    - Choose: Red Flag (dealbreaker), Green Flag (love it), or Beige Flag (meh)
    - Limited beige flags per game forces decisive choices
    - Score points when both pick Red or both pick Green
